metadata.name: PowerShell Write-EventLog Usage
metadata.comment: Detects usage of the "Write-EventLog" cmdlet with 'RawData' flag. The cmdlet can be levreage to write malicious payloads to the EventLog and then retrieve them later for later use

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('write-eventlog')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-rawdata ')))

output.summary: Detects usage of the "Write-EventLog" cmdlet with 'RawData' flag. The cmdlet can be levreage to write malicious payloads to the EventLog and then retrieve them later for later use

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate applications writing events via this cmdlet. Investigate alerts to determine if the action is benign Reference: https://www.blackhillsinfosec.com/windows-event-logs-for-red-teams/
